words.definition: To hurt or have pain.
words.example: My head aches because it is loud.

words.definition: Related to the North Pole.
words.example: It is very cold in the arctic region.

words.definition: A path for water to travel through.
words.example: The city has many canals for boats.

words.definition: A scientist who works with chemicals.
words.example: The chemist is testing new medicine.

words.definition: A feeling of coldness.
words.example: I felt a chill when I went outside.

words.definition: A group of leaders who make laws.
words.example: Congress passed a new law today.

words.definition: Food made from milk.
words.example: Cheese and butter are dairy products.

words.definition: To go down.
words.example: He descended the stairs slowly.

words.definition: A person who sells food.
words.example: The grocer sold me fresh fruit.

words.definition: To wait before doing something.
words.example: Don't hesitate to ask for help.

words.definition: An organization like a school or bank.
words.example: This is a large financial institution.

words.definition: To run slowly for exercise.
words.example: I jog every morning in the park.

words.definition: A person who buys and sells things.
words.example: The merchant traveled to many cities.

words.definition: To push with your finger or a tool.
words.example: He poked the fire with a stick.

words.definition: To do something at a later time.
words.example: They postponed the game until Monday.

words.definition: To make water fly in the air.
words.example: The kids splashed in the pool.

words.definition: Not wanting to change your mind.
words.example: He is too stubborn to listen to me.

words.definition: An area where people live outside a city.
words.example: We live in a quiet suburb.

words.definition: The rise and fall of the ocean.
words.example: The tide comes in every evening.

words.definition: A very sad event.
words.example: The accident was a real tragedy.
